column4: anywho......... I have another issue
I need to complie a program that doesn't have a "makefile"
well, I know vista has an issue
vista refuses to see XP
and hence I have th ever-annoying "tri-boot on grub" issue
I need to complie a program that doesn't have a "makefile" how would I do so
but I'm working on booting it seperatly
does it have autoconf or automake stuff for making it ?  is it perl stuff ?   is there a readme or install or similiar ?
the app? lemme check
nope
hmm...  small program ?   few files ?   maybe just run gcc on it.
it's secondlife
gcc -i whatever.c++  -o whatever_you_want_bin_name_to_be

oh.  there should be build instructions somewhere, or a linux folder, or a howto on a the net or something.  check for a docs or Documentation folder too.  maybe builds folder will have a linux script
hm.. seems to already be compiled, according to Lindinlabs
is there a bin/ directory ?
Pirate_Hunter: I use NTFS mounting on linux
yes
question...
dunno...   you can run the command, file bin/filename on it and see what kind of file it is.
